meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be preserved.
meanings.sent1: The preservabilities of ancient artifacts amaze historians.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider the preservabilities of food when storing it.
meanings.sent3: The preservabilities of the time capsule were put to the test when it was accidentally buried deeper than planned.
meanings.sent4: Her love letters had the preservabilities of a time machine, taking her back to the past with each read.
meanings.sent5: The preservabilities of the old photograph made it a cherished family heirloom.

meanings.definition: The ability to be maintained or kept intact over time.
meanings.sent1: The preservabilities of the historic building were a testament to skilled craftsmanship.
meanings.sent2: Proper packaging is essential to ensure the preservabilities of delicate items during shipping.
meanings.sent3: The preservabilities of the cake were put to the ultimate test when left unattended in a room full of hungry children.
meanings.sent4: His memories had the preservabilities of a time capsule, keeping the past alive in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The preservabilities of the ancient manuscript made it a valuable treasure for scholars.
